summary: DOD spends billions of dollars a year on sole-source spare parts contracts to keep its planes, ships, and systems operating. DOD relies on cost or pricing data from contractors to determine if prices for spare parts are reasonable. title: Spare Parts Contracts: Collecting Additional Information Could Help DOD Address Delays in Obtaining Cost or Pricing Data
